chrome.contextMenus

Top-Level Variables
contextMenus: ChromeContextMenus
Classes
ChromeContextMenus
OnClickData

Use the chrome.contextMenus API to add items to Google Chrome's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeContextMenus contextMenus

Accessor for the chrome.contextMenus namespace.

Class ChromeContextMenus

Fields
onClicked: Stream
Getters and Setters
onClicked: Stream<dynamic>
Methods
create(Map<dynamic, dynamic> createProperties, dynamic callback): dynamic
remove(dynamic menuItemId): Future<dynamic>
removeAll(): Future<dynamic>
update(dynamic id, Map<dynamic, dynamic> updateProperties): Future<dynamic>

Fields

final Stream onClicked

Getters and Setters

Stream<dynamic> get onClicked

Fired when a context menu item is clicked.

Methods

dynamic create(Map<dynamic, dynamic> createProperties, dynamic callback)

Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in chrome.runtime.lastError).

callback Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in chrome.runtime.lastError.

Returns: The ID of the newly created item.

Future<dynamic> remove(dynamic menuItemId)

Removes a context menu item.

menuItemId The ID of the context menu item to remove.

Future<dynamic> removeAll()

Removes all context menu items added by this extension.

Future<dynamic> update(dynamic id, Map<dynamic, dynamic> updateProperties)

Updates a previously created context menu item.

id The ID of the item to update.

updateProperties The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.

Class OnClickData extends ChromeObject

Constructors
OnClickData(JsObject proxy)

Information sent when a context menu item is clicked.

Constructors

OnClickData(JsObject proxy)
